Package framework

The package framework introduces all parts of the mix and the overall framework, which are not exchanged.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ComponentReferences
    the interface ComponentReferences provides access to all the controllers, the logger and the settings class of a specific mix and to the mix itself
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Controller
    The abstract class Controller provides all methods, interfaces and fields that are needed by every controller.
    DuplicatePrintStream
    PrintStream that writes all data provided to it to two PrintStreams, ie. it duplicates the stream.
    Framework
    The class Framework is responsible for setting up the environment and loading all necessary components.
    Implementation
    The abstract class Implementation implements the ComponentReferences interface, so that a particular implementation of a component knows about all Controllers of all other components of the mix.
    LocalClassLoader
    The LocalClassLoader extends the standard Java ClassLoader and is used to load the specific implementation classes into the framework and for testing purposes into the GUI.
    Logger
    Logs and displays output and error messages.
    Mix
    This class coordinates the components of this mix.
    MixProperties
    Provides methods to load properties from a file and to convert property keys to different formats.
    Settings
    Provides properties from the file Properties.properties and provides methods to manipulate these properties.
    Util
    Offers static methods for converting data types (which are of general use, but not offered by the java API).

Package framework Description

The package framework introduces all parts of the mix and the overall framework, which are not exchanged.

First, it establishes the interfaces Controller and Implementation which are used by the implementations of all the components of the mix. Each component (offering methods) has its own (architecture) interface (see package architectureInterfaces). Furthermore, the interface ComponentReferences is provided, which enables all components to access all of the controllers, the logger and the settings class of a specific mix and the mix itself.

Second, the mix itself is provided. The class Mix itself sets up one mix to be used in a mix cascade.

General information: A mix is some kind of proxy that attempts to hide the correspondence between its incoming and outgoing messages, as proposed by David Chaum in 1981.

Third, the classes Logger, Settings, DuplicatePrintStream, Util and MixProperties are provided for internal tasks of the mix.

Fourth, the helper class LocalClassLoader is provided. This class is responsible for loading the specified Implementations.

The Framework itself sets up the environment, starts mixes and provides the necessary components. This class could also be used to test the mixing.

See Also:
Information, InputOutputHandlerInterface, ExternalInformationPortController
